p: Lignocellulosic biomass hydrolysates contain mainly two sugars, namely glucose and xylose, whereas other sugars such as mannose and arabinose might be present, depending on the source of biomass [ 26]. Glucose is the most preferred carbon source among such monomeric carbon sources by the majority of microorganisms [ 11]. The microorganisms do not shift to the consumption of other sugars until glucose is fully consumed. Co-utilization of glucose with other sugar sources is rarely observed, however, this strategy has potential to improve the economics of biofuel and value-added chemical production by microbial fermentation [ 13].
